result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel O Bourdo

defendant.name: Bourdo, Daniel O
defendant.address: 2301 W College Ave Unit 706, Oak Creek, WI 53154

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel O Bourdo in court, in custody, by video.  Attorney Joshua Ryan-Polczinski in court for Daniel O Bourdo.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Reading of complaint waived. Rights given and preliminary hearing requested within time period. Defendant's wife is willing to co-sign but is not present today. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Ryan, argument. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel O Bourdo appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Daniel O Bourdo.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify bond by Attorny Obi Ozowulu. , state objects to motion. Court DENIED motion, bond remains. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Daniel O Bourdo in custody, via video, in court. Attorney Vivian Ten Haken appearing for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify bond by defendant. Denied by court. Bond remains as is. State needs time to make a charging decision. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Cash bond filed. Defendant refused to sign.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 
22-4931 & 22-4932
